ags:resource.dc:title: Bilancia fosforu a draslíka v integrovanej a ekologickej sústave hospodárenia na pôde

dc:title.dcterms:alternative: Balance of phosphorus and potassium in integrated and ecological farming system on soil

dc:creator.ags:creatorCorporate: Slovak University of Agriculture, Nitra, Slovak Republic

dc:description.dcterms:abstract: Balance of phosphorus and potassium was evaluated in six-field crop rotation organized in both integrated (IS) and ecological (ES) farming system within small-pot field experiment in years 2010/2011- 2012/2013. There were examined two treatments of fertilization: unfertilized (O) and fertilized (OR). Crop rotation consisted of the following crops: maize for silage - winter wheat - spring barley - common pea - bean + alfalfa - alfaIfa. Balance of phosphorus was negative with an exception in fertilized treatment in integrated system. On the average of three experimental years medium balance surplus of phosphorus (15.85 kg.ha.yr ) was found out in l/OR treatment. Balance of potassium was negative in both soil farming systems and fertilized treatments. The highest deficit of potassium was in unfertilized treatment in ecological farming system (-228.78 kg·ha.yr). Balance of potassium was the closest to fulfil requirements of sustainable farming in fertilized treatment of integrated system in 2013. Higher rate of potassium fertilizers and application of farm-yard manure caused nearly optimal balance of potassium (-2.68 kg.ha.yr). On the average of three experimental years the most favourable balance of NPK nutrients was achieved on fertilized treatment in integrated farming system. Balance of both nitrogen and potassium was negative (N = -6.31 kq.ha.yr
K = -93.01 kg.ha.yr). Balance of phosphorus was positive, representing medium balance surplus of 15.85 kg.ha.yr.
